info.title: API
info.description:
Platnova's Business API allows businesses to issue virtual accounts and cards to their employees, vendors, or retail customers. It allows businesses to streamline the process of issuing cards, manage spending, and track transactions. The API documentation provides information on how to integrate our virtual card issuing system into a business's existing systems and outlines the features and functionalities of the API, including card and account creation, management, and reporting. It also provides technical specifications, such as API requests, responses, and authentication processes.

The API documentation is intended for developers and IT teams to use in order to effectively implement Platnova solutions into their business processes.

# Authentication/Authorization

To access any of the resources on the `{BaseUrl}/v1/`, the client has to pass pre-defined headers for authentication and authorization.

The API is secure and only authorized clients can consume the service. There are API keys assigned to every business and JWT tokens assigned to every account for authentication/authorization.

## Bearer Token

Requests may accept jwt tokens as below.

``` json
Authorization: Bearer <jwt token>

 ```

## API Key

Requests may acccept an api key either in the request headers or as a query parameter. Some requests cannot be authorized using an API key.

``` json
X-API-KEY: <api key>

 ```

OR

``` json
?api-key=<api key>

 ```

# Base URL

[https://sandbox.api.platnova.co](https://sandbox.api.platnova.co)

# Errors

Unauthorized API key

``` json
{
    "status": false,
    "data": {},
    "error": [],
    "message": "unauthorized access"
}

 ```

Permission Denied

``` json
{
    "status": false,
    "data": {},
    "error": [],
    "message": "unauthorized access: permission denied"
}

 ```

200.description: Receipt generated successfully (base64-encoded data in data field)

400.description: Transaction not found or invalid id
Bad request (e.g. payment methods required, amount required when customer cannot set price, invalid payment method)

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of payment links for the authenticated entity.
Retrieve a payment link by UID including statistics (total_revenue, total_transactions, total_users, total_views, payment_details).

200.description: Payment link with stats retrieved successfully

400.description: Bad request (link not found or not owned by entity)
Bad request (user not found, payment methods required, invalid payment method)

payment_details.description: Bank/payment details when payment method supports it

400.description: Bad request (invoice not found or not owned by entity)
Bad request (e.g. invalid or missing session)

ValidationError422.description: Validation error response (422). Keys are request body field names.

error.description: Field name to list of error messages

beneficiary_account_id.description: Required for USD; business beneficiary account UID

wallet_id.description: Wallet ID for the account currency

payment_method.description: One of: card, bank_transfer, mobile_money, wallet, tag_transfer, defi, revolut, paypal, cashapp, zelle, ussd

info.description: Recipient details; required fields depend on payment_method (e.g. account_number, bank_code, account_name for bank_transfer; tag_id for tag_transfer)

frequency.description: For recurring: e.g. daily, weekly, monthly

approver.description: Account UID to notify for approval (non-owner)

amount.description: Fixed amount; required when customer.can_set_price is false

can_set_price.description: If true, payer can choose amount; then amount may be omitted

limit.description: Max number of payments per link

email.description: Email of the user (customer) in the entity to invoice
